questions.text:
Statements: H > I \u2265 J = K < L; M = N < K \u2265 O 
Conclusions: 
I. H > O 
II. L > M
questions.solution:
Combine statements: H > I \u2265 J = K \u2265 O and L > K > N = M. 
I. H > ... \u2265 O implies H > O (True). 
II. L > K > N = M implies L > M (True). 
Both follow.

questions.text:
Statements: A = B \u2264 C < D; E \u2265 F > C 
Conclusions: 
I. E > A 
II. F > B
questions.solution:
Combine: E \u2265 F > C \u2265 B = A. 
I. E > ... > C \u2265 A -> E > A (True). 
II. F > C \u2265 B -> F > B (True). 
Both follow.

questions.text:
Statements: P \u2265 Q > R \u2264 S; T < R 
Conclusions: 
I. P > T 
II. Q \u2265 S
questions.solution:
I. P \u2265 Q > R > T -> P > T (True). 
II. Q > R \u2264 S. Signs are opposite between Q and S. (False).

questions.text:
Statements: X > Y = Z \u2265 W; V < U \u2264 W 
Conclusions: 
I. X > V 
II. Z \u2265 U
questions.solution:
Combine: X > Y = Z \u2265 W \u2265 U > V. 
I. X > ... > V (True). 
II. Z \u2265 W \u2265 U -> Z \u2265 U (True).

questions.text:
Statements: D \u2264 E < F = G; H \u2265 G 
Conclusions: 
I. H > D 
II. E < H
questions.solution:
Combine: H \u2265 G = F > E \u2265 D. 
I. H > D (True). 
II. H > E which is same as E < H (True).

questions.text:
Statements: Only a few Cups are Mugs. All Mugs are Plates. No Plate is a Spoon. 
Conclusions: 
I. Some Cups are not Spoons 
II. Some Cups are not Mugs
questions.solution:
I. Some Cups are Mugs -> Plates. Plates are No Spoon. So that part of Cup is not Spoon. (True). 
II. 'Only a few Cups are Mugs' means Some are and Some are NOT. (True).

questions.text:
Statements: Some Files are Folders. Some Folders are Papers. No Paper is a Pen. 
Conclusions: 
I. Some Files are not Pens 
II. Some Folders are not Pens
questions.solution:
I. No direct relation between File and Pen. (False). 
II. Some Folders are Papers, and No Paper is Pen. So the part of Folder that is Paper is not Pen. (True).

questions.text:
Statements: All Rivers are Lakes. All Lakes are Oceans. Some Oceans are Seas. 
Conclusions: 
I. All Rivers being Seas is a possibility 
II. Some Lakes are Seas
questions.solution:
I. There is no negative statement. Rivers can be inside Seas in a possible diagram. (True). 
II. Lakes are inside Oceans, Seas intersect Oceans. Seas don't necessarily touch Lakes. (False).

questions.text:
Statements: No Apple is Banana. Only a few Bananas are Mangoes. All Mangoes are Grapes. 
Conclusions: 
I. Some Grapes are Bananas 
II. No Apple is Mango
questions.solution:
I. Bananas intersect Mangoes. Mangoes are inside Grapes. So Bananas must intersect Grapes. (True). 
II. No Apple is Banana. Mango intersects Banana. Apple could intersect the part of Mango that is not Banana. (False).

questions.text:
Statements: All Keys are Locks. Some Locks are Doors. All Doors are Windows. 
Conclusions: 
I. Some Windows are Locks 
II. Some Windows are Keys
questions.solution:
I. Doors are Windows. Locks intersect Doors. So Windows must intersect Locks. (True). 
II. Keys are inside Locks. Windows intersect Locks (via Doors). Windows don't necessarily touch Keys. (False).

questions.text:
Directions (11-15): Study the following numbers: 427 581 268 943 715 

Q11. If 1 is added to the last digit of each number, how many numbers will be divisible by 3?

Directions: 427 581 268 943 715 

Q12. If the first and third digits of each number are interchanged, which number will be the second highest?
questions.solution:
Interchanged numbers: 724, 185, 862, 349, 517. 
Order: 862 (Highest), 724 (2nd Highest). 
724 comes from 427. 
Wait, 724 is highest? No, 862 is highest. 724 is 2nd highest. 
Origin of 724 is 427. 
Wait, options order: 
862 (268), 724 (427), 517 (715), 349 (943), 185 (581). 
Highest: 268 (becomes 862). 
2nd Highest: 427 (becomes 724). 
Answer is 427. 
My correctIndex 4 points to 715. 715 becomes 517. That is 3rd highest. 
Let me re-read solution. 2nd highest number formed. 
862 > 724 > 517. 
So 427 is the answer. Correct option index is 0. 
Correction: Change index to 0.

questions.text:
Directions: 427 581 268 943 715 

Q13. If all digits in each number are arranged in ascending order within the number, which number will be the lowest?
questions.solution:
Arranged: 
427 -> 247 
581 -> 158 
268 -> 268 
943 -> 349 
715 -> 157 
Comparison: 157 is lowest. 
157 comes from 715. Answer is 715.

questions.text:
Directions: 427 581 268 943 715 

Q14. What is the sum of the second digit of the highest number and the third digit of the lowest number?
questions.solution:
Highest Number = 943. Second digit = 4. 
Lowest Number = 268. Third digit = 8. 
Sum = 4 + 8 = 12.

questions.text:
Directions: 427 581 268 943 715 

Q15. If 2 is subtracted from the first digit of every odd number and 1 is added to the last digit of every even number, how many numbers will be greater than 500?
questions.solution:
Odd numbers: 427, 581, 943, 715. 
Even numbers: 268. 
Operation on Odd (Minus 2 from 1st): 427->227, 581->381, 943->743, 715->515. 
Operation on Even (Add 1 to last): 268->269. 
Numbers > 500: 743 (from 943) and 515 (from 715). 
Total 2.

questions.text:
Directions (16-20): In a certain code: 
'green blue white black' is 'hu ma sam do' 
'white orange yellow green' is 'sam na fa hu' 
'blue violet orange red' is 'ma fa ga pa' 

Q16. What is the code for 'orange'?
questions.solution: Compare 2 & 3: 'orange' is common. 'fa' is common. Code is fa.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q16) 

Q17. What does 'hu' stand for?
questions.solution:
Compare 1 & 2: 'green' and 'white' are common. 'hu' and 'sam' are common. 
Cannot distinguish. Answer: Either white or green.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q16) 

Q18. What is the code for 'black'?
questions.solution:
From 1: 'green', 'white', 'blue' appear in other sentences. 'black' is unique. 
Codes 'hu', 'sam', 'ma' appear elsewhere. 'do' is unique. Code is do.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q16) 

Q19. Which word is coded as 'ma'?
questions.solution: Compare 1 & 3: 'blue' is common. 'ma' is common. Code is blue.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q16) 

Q20. What could be the code for 'yellow pink'?
questions.solution:
'yellow' is in 2 only. Codes 'na' is unique in 2. So yellow is 'na'. 
'pink' is a new word. Needs new code. 
Options with 'na': 'na pa' (pa is in 3), 'na ki' (ki is new). 
'ki' is a valid new code. 'pa' means violet/red. 
So 'na ki' is the answer.

questions.text:
Directions (21-23): Family has 7 members. A is mother of B. C is father of D. B is wife of C. E is son of D. F is sister of E. G is father of B. 

Q21. How is G related to C?
questions.solution: B is wife of C. G is father of B. So G is Father-in-law of C.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q21) 

Q22. How is F related to B?
questions.solution:
B is wife of C. C is father of D. D is parent of E and F. 
Wait, C is father of D. So B is mother of D. 
D is parent of E (son) and F (sister of E). 
So B is Grandmother of F. 
And F is Granddaughter of B. 
Let's re-read: 'E is son of D'. 'F is sister of E'. 
So D is father/mother of F. 
B is mother of D. 
So F is Granddaughter.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q21) 

Q23. How is A related to E?
questions.solution:
A is mother of B. B is mother of D. D is parent of E. 
A is Great Grandmother of E.

questions.text:
Point A is 10m North of Point B. Point C is 5m East of Point B. Point D is 5m South of Point C. Point E is 10m West of Point D. 

Q24. What is the direction of Point A with respect to Point E?
questions.solution:
E is West of D. D is South of C. C is East of B. B is South of A. 
Coordinates: A(0,10), B(0,0), C(5,0), D(5,-5), E(-5,-5). 
A is at (0,10). E is at (-5, -5). 
A is North and East of E. 
Answer North-East.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q24) 

Q25. What is the shortest distance between B and D?

Directions (26-30): Eight persons P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W sit around a circular table facing the center. 
- P is 2nd to the right of T. 
- S is 3rd to the left of P. 
- U is immediate right of S. 
- Q is 2nd to the right of U. 
- V is neighbor of Q. 
- R is not neighbor of P. 

Q26. Who sits immediate left of W?
questions.solution:
Arrangement: 
1. Place T. P is 2nd Right. 
2. S is 3rd Left of P (implies S is immediate right of T). 
3. U is immediate right of S. 
4. Q is 2nd right of U. 
5. V is neighbor of Q. (Check empty spots). 
6. R not near P. 
Let's trace spots 1-8 CW. 
1(T), 2(S), 3(U), 4(P), 5(Q), 6(V/R?), 7(V/R?), 8(...). 
Re-trace: 
T at 1. P at 3 (2nd right? No, 1->2->3). 
S is 3rd left of P -> 3->2->1->8. S is at 8. 
U is imm right of S -> U at 1? No T is at 1. Conflict. 
Let's restart carefully. 
T at 1. 
P is 2nd Right -> P at 3. 
S is 3rd Left of P -> Left of 3 is 2, 1, 8. S is at 8. 
U is imm right of S -> U is at 1? But T is at 1. 
Wait, 'Immediate right of S'. If S is at 8, Right is 1. 
Is T=U? Impossible. 
Read 'S is 3rd to the left of P'. 
Maybe S is at 8. U is at 1. 
Maybe T and U are same? No. 
Is there a misunderstanding of '2nd to right'? 
1(T), 2, 3(P). 
Left of 3: 2, 1, 8. S is at 8. 
Imm Right of 8 is 1. U at 1. 
Conflict with T. 
Maybe S is 3rd Left of P means P is 3rd Right of S? 
Let's check question source logic. Maybe I drafted it wrong? 
Let's Modify Question for valid puzzle: 
- P is 2nd to right of T. 
- S is 3rd to right of P. 
- U is imm right of S. 
- Q is 2nd left of U. 
Let's Solve Modified: 
1(T) -> 3(P) -> 6(S) -> 7(U) -> 5(Q). 
Spots left: 2, 4, 8. 
V neighbor of Q -> V at 4 (since 6 is S). 
R not neighbor of P -> R cannot be 2 or 4. V is 4. So R is 8. 
Remaining W is 2. 
Order CW from T: T(1), W(2), P(3), V(4), Q(5), S(6), U(7), R(8). 
Check R not neighbor P (8 not next to 3). Yes. 
Check V neighbor Q (4 next to 5). Yes. 
Valid. 
Q26: Imm left of W? 
W is at 2. Left is 1 (T). 
Wait, P is at 3. W at 2. Imm left of W is T. 
Option B: T. 
Let's verify logic again. 
W(2). Left is 1(T). Right is 3(P). 
Correct Index 1 (T).

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q26) 

Q27. Who sits opposite to V?
questions.solution:
V is at 4. Opposite is 8. 
8 is R. 
Answer R.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q26) 

Q28. How many persons sit between P and Q when counted from the right of P?
questions.solution:
P(3). Q(5). Right of P is 4(V). 
Between P and Q is V. One person.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q26) 

Q29. What is the position of R with respect to U?
questions.solution:
U(7). R(8). 
R is immediate left of U (facing center, left is clockwise). 
Wait, standard numbering 1-8 is usually Clockwise. 
If 1,2,3... is CW: 
U(7) -> Left is 8(R). Correct. 
Imm Left.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q26) 

Q30. Which pair sits adjacent to S?
questions.solution:
S is at 6. Neighbors 5(Q) and 7(U). 
Pair Q, U.

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Seven persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G sit in a straight row facing North. 
- A is 3rd from the left end. 
- Two persons between A and C. 
- B is immediate right of C. 
- D is 2nd to the left of E. 
- E is not at an extreme end. 
- F is to the left of G. 

Q31. Who sits at the extreme right end?
questions.solution:
Positions 1-7. 
A is 3rd from left -> Pos 3. 
2 between A and C -> C can be 6. (3+2+1). 
B imm right of C -> B is 7. 
D 2nd left of E. E not extreme (not 1 or 7). 
E could be 4? D at 2. 
E could be 5? D at 3 (Occupied by A). No. 
So E is 4, D is 2. 
Remaining 1 and 5. 
F left of G -> F at 1, G at 5. 
Arrangement: F(1), D(2), A(3), E(4), G(5), C(6), B(7). 
Extreme right is B.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q31) 

Q32. How many persons sit between D and G?
questions.solution: D(2), G(5). Between: 3, 4 (A, E). Two persons.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q31) 

Q33. Who sits immediate left of A?
questions.solution: A is at 3. Imm left is 2 (D).

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q31) 

Q34. What is the position of F with respect to E?
questions.solution:
E(4). F(1). 
F is 3rd to the left of E.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q31) 

Q35. Which of the following is true?
options: C sits 2nd to right of E
questions.solution:
E(4), C(6). C is 2nd to right of E. True. 
Check others: G(5) not end. F(1), B(7) not neighbors. D(2) is 6th from right. 
Option 2 (C sits 2nd to right of E) is correct.

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Seven boxes P, Q, R, S, T, U, V are stacked one above another. 
- V is placed at the top. 
- Only 2 boxes between V and S. 
- P is immediately above S. 
- Number of boxes above P is same as below Q. 
- R is above T. 
- U is below T. 

Q36. Which box is at the bottom?
questions.solution:
Positions 7(Top) to 1(Bottom). 
V is 7. 
2 between V and S -> S is 4. 
P imm above S -> P is 5. 
Above P = 2 boxes (6,7). Below Q = 2 boxes. Q is 3. 
R above T, U below T. Remaining spots 6, 2, 1. 
R must be 6. T must be 2. U must be 1. 
Order: V(7), R(6), P(5), S(4), Q(3), T(2), U(1). 
Bottom is U.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q36) 

Q37. How many boxes are between R and Q?
questions.solution: R(6), Q(3). Between: 5, 4 (P, S). Two boxes.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q36) 

Q38. Which box is immediately below P?
questions.solution: P(5). Below is S(4).

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q36) 

Q39. Position of T?
questions.solution: T is at 2. 2nd from bottom.

questions.text:
Directions: (Same as Q36) 

Q40. Find the odd one out.
